DataElement.preferredName: Refractory Disease Specimen Submission Induction Failure Timepoint Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the timepoint at which the refractory specimen was submitted for the Induction Failure Project.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Refractory Disease Specimen Neoadjuvant Therapy Failure Submission Timepoint
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disease that resists treatment._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The administration of therapeutic agents prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective._A lack of occurrence or performance._The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease that resists treatment.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The administration of therapeutic agents prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.:A lack of occurrence or performance.:The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Concepts.definition: Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
A lack of occurrence or performance.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
